title: Investigators Narrow GM-Switch Probe
text:
Biography Christopher M. Matthews July 24, 2015 1:12 p.m. ET 
The U.S. Justice Department is unlikely to charge General Motors Co. with bankruptcy fraud, people familiar with the matter said, closing off one avenue for bringing a criminal case against the auto maker over a deadly ignition-switch defect. 
Prosecutors in the U.S. Attorneyâ€™s Office in Manhattan continue to weigh charging GM with criminal wire-fraud after determining the auto maker likely made misleading statements and concealed information about the faulty switch in communications with regulators and others, the people...
